intro: Senecio gunnii, commonly known as the Gunns' groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small yellow flowers that are surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a unique appearance. Senecio gunnii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact growth habit and attractive foliage.
